answers.answer: My doctor said normal weight gain was 25 to 70 lbs.  If you have gained 75 lbs then it probably will make you more tired and achy and short of breath and such, as weight will do. Can also increase chances of diabetes. But if you haven't gained 75 ( and I bet you haven't...) I wouldnt worry much at all unless your own personal doctor expresses concern. Everyone is different and gains differently. As long as you are active and eating healthy balanced foods you arr probably plenty healthy.
Over weight for yourself or the baby??

(Seriously... 70lb is really quite a lot and I don't think its extremely common, though it does happen...  but the point was being made that everyone is different and as long as you strive to be healthy you'll be OK regardless of numbers.)
Ive gained 35 pounds my entire pregnancy
I went from 145 to 204 by the time my first baby was born but he turned out to be 10lbs 7oz. You could just be having a big baby.
I've gained 40 pounds so far and according to this app  I'm in the excessive weight gain category so I have no idea what they base it on... I went from 110-150 .. ....

question: Im 35 going.on 36 weeks & im like 5 pounds above normal weight is that.bad or going to affect anything
title: 35 weeks to much weight
